CONJUGATES: sow | sows | sowed | sown (past participle) | sowing (present participle) (verb); sows (noun, plural)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English 'sāwan' (verb, 'to sow, to plant'), from Proto-Germanic '*sēaną', ultimately from Proto-Indo-European '*seh₁-' ('to sow, to plant'). The noun 'sow' (female pig) is from Old English 'sugu', from Proto-Germanic '*sugō', ultimately from Proto-Indo-European '*su-' ('pig').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: vtr: transitive verb (takes a direct object) | vitr: intransitive verb (does not take a direct object)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To plant seeds by scattering them on or in the earth.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 播种；撒种 (将种子散播在土壤中)。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The farmer will sow the wheat in the spring, hoping for a bountiful harvest.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 农民将在春天播种小麦，希望能有个好收成。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: vtr: transitive verb (takes a direct object)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To introduce or spread something, especially feelings, ideas, or problems, that will cause trouble or have a particular effect.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 散布；激起 (尤指负面情绪、思想或麻烦，以造成困扰或特定结果)。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: His intention was to sow discord among the team members.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他的意图是在团队成员中散布不和。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: n: noun (a word that refers to a person, place, thing, event, substance, or quality)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An adult female pig. (Note: This noun is pronounced /saʊ/, unlike the verb /soʊ/). It can also be used informally as a derogatory term for a fat, untidy, or unpleasant woman.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 成年母猪。(注意：该名词发音为/saʊ/，与动词/soʊ/不同)。口语中也可贬义指肥胖、不整洁或令人不快的女人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The sow fiercely protected her newborn piglets from the cold.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 那头母猪凶猛地保护着她刚出生的小猪仔免受寒冷。

REGISTER: General usage for the verb; agricultural or informal/derogatory for the noun.
